Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

I am using an AdobeRGB gamut monitor, correctly calibrated with a v2 profile. I have set up firefox 4 to use this profile, and image rendering in the main browser pane is generally very good.

However, I notice that the favicons embedded in tabs and in the url bar are not managed- whereas viewing the same sorts of images in the main browser pane will correctly assume casting to an sRGB colour space, keeping the colours correct, in the tabs and url bar, the colours are far too bright and saturated. This is characteristic of incorrectly displaying an sRGB image in a large colourspace without correct management.

If you add a bookmark to the same site to the bookmark bar, the colours are correctly managed, and the favicon is not terrifyingly bright and saturated- right below the incorrectly unmanaged tab, also.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set up an Adobe RGB monitor, calibrated and make firefix use the profile.
2. Visit a site with a brightly-coloured favicon- http://www.flickr.com works well
3. Add the same site to the bookmark bar,

Actual Results:  
Colours in the favicon displayed in tab and url bar are terrifyingly bright and saturated. Colours in the bookmark bar's favicon are correct.

Expected Results:  
Colours in the tab and url bar's version of the favicon should not be far too bright and saturated. They should be the same as the colours in the correctly-managed bookmark toolbar.

The software should be applying colour management to the display of favicons in the tabs and url bar.

What's the value of "gfx.color_management.mode" in about:config?

And if it's not set to 1, does setting it to 1 and restarting Firefox fix it?

And if it's not set to 1, does setting it to 1 and restarting Firefox fix it?

comments.raw_text:
Without wishing to seem rude, I think maybe you didn't understand the report. Probably my bad for not being clear enough.

Colour management is correctly set up, it's working, it looks great,in the main pane. No problem there, untagged and tagged images all work fine.

Favicons are unmanaged, in the tabs at the top of the page, and the url bar only. The same thing is managed just fine in the bookmark toolbar.

Yes, it's set up properly, that variable is indeed set to 1. If it weren't, the main pane colour management would be wrong. No, a restart won't fix it. It's just a bug where the tabs and url bar don't seem to be rendering the favicons in a colour managed manner.

Sorry if that sounds catty, it's not intended to be, just striving for clarity. Delighted that anyone cares enough to even ask the question. It's not the most severe bug ever, after all.
